docs.title: PhD Candidate in Nuclear and Particle Physics
Welcome
docs.text:
I am a PhD candidate in Nuclear and Particle Physics at the Complutense University of Madrid, specializing in radiation detectors, cosmic ray studies, and medical imaging applications. My research focuses on designing and optimizing advanced detector technologies for both fundamental physics and real-world applications.

This website serves as a hub for my publications, conference contributions, research projects, and outreach activities.

docs.title: Explore My Work
docs.text:
• Research & Publications – Papers and ongoing projects
  • Conferences & Talks – Scientific presentations
  • Science Outreach – Public engagement initiatives

Feel free to explore and reach out if you’d like to collaborate.

docs.title: About Me 👨‍🔬
docs.text:
I am a predoctoral researcher at the Complutense University of Madrid, specializing in Nuclear and Particle Physics with applications in Medical Physics and advanced detector development.

My work focuses on designing and optimizing radiation detectors for early cancer detection and studying cosmic rays.

docs.title: Master’s in Particle Physics and the Cosmos
docs.text:
• University of Cantabria (2022 - 2023)
  • Funded by the Spanish Nuclear Society Scholarship and CSIC JAE Intro Scholarship

docs.title: Double Degree in Physics and Mathematics
Researcher at Complutense University of Madrid (June 2023 - Present)
docs.text:
• Project: "New Generation of Molecular Imaging Devices for Breast Cancer (NeWMBI)"
  • Focus: Design and optimization of scintillation detectors for early cancer detection
  • Development of Resistive Plate Chambers (RPCs) for cosmic ray studies

docs.title: Predoctoral Fellowship at CSIC (2022 - 2023)
docs.text: • Worked at Institute of Physics of Cantabria (IFCA) on advanced detector technologies

docs.title: Research Trajectory 🚀
docs.text:
My research focuses on Nuclear and Particle Physics, with applications in medical imaging, radiation detectors, and cosmic ray studies. Over the years, I have contributed to various publications, conferences, research projects, and science outreach initiatives.

Explore the different sections below to learn more about my academic and research journey:

docs.title: 🔹 Sections in this Category
docs.text:
• Publications – Peer-reviewed journal articles and submitted works.
  • Conferences – Presentations, talks, and posters at international and national meetings.
  • Outreach & Science Communication – Efforts to engage the public with science.
  • Research Projects – Key projects I have been involved in, including detector development.

This section provides a structured overview of my contributions to the field. Click on any topic to explore in detail!

docs.title: Oral Presentations
docs.text:
• The miniTRASGO Cosmic Ray Telescope at XVII International Conference on Resistive Plate Chambers (RPC2024)
  • The first miniTRASGO Cosmic Ray Detector at XV CPAN Days (2023)

docs.title: Poster Presentations
docs.text: • The miniTRASGO Cosmic Ray Telescope at European Space Weather Week 2024

docs.title: Science Outreach
docs.text: • Coordinator at Madrid Science Week 2023: Led workshops like "How to use your mobile to see the invisible"

docs.title: Summer Course Organization
docs.text: • Natural Risks for Security: Climate Change and Geomagnetic Solar Storms (2018)

docs.title: NeWMBI Project (2022 - 2025)
docs.text:
• Development of radiation detectors for medical imaging
  • Role: Team member, contributing to detector design and optimization

docs.title: miniTRASGO: A Compact RPC Tracker for Global Cosmic Ray Studies
docs.text:
